elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1. INT. WEAPON SITE (CORRIDOR)
F/X A DOOR OPENS. MANNY (EARLY 20S, TIMID) WALKS INTO A CLEAN,
HI-TECH CORRIDOR.
(CALLING OUT) Hello? Is anyone here? I... I didn’t open the door, it just opened on its own. .. Hello? Could I get a ride back to
the Haulage offices?
F/X NO ANSWER. HE KEEPS WALKING, OPERATES A COMM DEVICE.
Violet? Pick up if you’re there.
F/X STATIC CRACKLE.

Look, comms are still dodgy. I can’t hear you, but maybe you can hear me. I got lost, my nav must be trashed. But it’s mad right, there’s like a whole other... complex on the other side. Under the ice. I reckoned I was in the unstable zone but I can’t [be —]
F/X A NOISE LIKE ESCAPING STEAM — A HISSING WHOOSH — SURROUNDS
THIS IS THE JOVIAN, A CLOUD-CREATURE. IT SEEPS FROM THE
VENT AND HANGS IN THE AIR AROUND MANNY.
Er.. I think something’s broken, there’s a noise like... wait, there’s a.. cloud in here.
F/X JOVIAN WHOOSHES AROUND MANNY.
Violet, I can’t see anything. I’m inside the cloud — it’s —
F/X JOVIAN STARTS TO GENERATE A LIGHTNING BOLT: A RISING HUM
AND CRACKLE.
I don’t like this, I think it’s going to —
F/X LIGHTNING BOLT.
SCREAMS
GRAMS DR WHO THEME
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 2
SCENE 2. INT. TARDIS
F/X BACKGROUND HUM. TEGAN ENTERS.
Have we landed yet?
Yes and no. We’ve materialised in space.
Why?
Why not? I like space. Earth’s solar system, 2329. And if you look at the scanner, you’1ll see something rather interesting in five... four... three...
F/X RUSH AS COMET GOES PAST SCANNER.
Oh. Evidently it was going faster than I thought.
What was that?
A comet.
Really?
You’re going to say it didn’t look like a comet.
I don’t know what comets look like. Not up close.
They’re not balls of fire searing their way across the sky.
I know.
They’re mostly ice. You can land on them.
Let’s land on it.
F/X DOCTOR STARTS OPERATING THE CONTROLS.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 3
Should be easy enough from here, a short hop.
F/X NYSSA ENTERS.
Are we landing?
Hello, where’ve you been? You weren’t in your bed this morning.
No, I couldn’t sleep so I got up and went to the library to read.
You must be tired now.
No, actually.
A side effect of your rejuvenation. Don’t worry, it’1ll settle down. I was just the same after my third regeneration. Got quite a lot done.
I could do with a dip in the Fountain of Youth myself. Travelling with you’s exhausting.
Where are we landing?
On a comet.
Why?
Because we can.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 3. EXT. COMMERCIAL ZONE
F/X A SMALL SHOPPING PRECINCT INSIDE A DOMED SETTLEMENT.
MUSAK. TARDIS LANDS. DOOR OPENS, TEGAN STEPS OUT FOLLOWED BY OTHERS.
This is a comet? It looks more like a motorway services.
F/X A TALKING ADVERTISEMENT ON THE WALL SPEAKS.
(D) New recipe Molk tastes like milk that came from the dairy yesterday — but stays fresh for up to five years!
NYSSA3: It does seem rather... commercialised.
Whatever I was expecting, it wasn’t a supermarket and a clothing store and a.. Mexican restaurant?
(F/X: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) I think this is a haulage rock.
Haulage?
If a comet’s on the right path, it can be a cheap alternative to freight. Like second class post.
F/X TEGAN HAS STOPPED WALKING. AND LISTENING.
What’s second class post?
Yes, I sometimes wish the TARDIS would go one step further and translate my analogies.
(OFF) Nyssa — come and look at this.
But why all the shops?
A business like this needs employees — brokers, engineers, accountants, lawyers, security staff — and employees use shops. It’s a whole mini-economy.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 4. INT. FALCAO’S OFFICE
F/X ANTON FALCAO (LATE-30S, SLIGHTLY INTENSE) IS USING A LASER
SCALPEL TO CARVE A SCULPTURE. HIS COMM MAKES THE NOISE OF AN
TELEPHONE. HE SPEAKS AND THE RINGING STOPS.
Yes, Falcao here?
F/X A SCREEN BLINKS INTO LIFE. ON IT IS PATRICIA WALTON (40S,
FRIENDLY, SMART). FALCAO KEEPS WORKING WHILST THEY TALK.
(D) Hard at work, Anton?
Believe it or not, Patricia, yes I am. Sculpture helps me think.
(D) I’m joking. (BEAT) I’ve just spoken to the shareholders.
Oh.
(D) They want to know if there’s been any progress.
What did you tell them?
(D) I was halfway through explaining how under-resourced we are. Then the line went dead, thankfully.
The blackouts are getting worse. Can’t we do anything about it?
(D) It’s back up now, but I wanted to talk to you before calling them back.
I don’t know what they expect from us. My team is not a detective agency, we are not forensically —
F/X SKRINK. A PIECE OF FALCAO’S SCULPTURE FALLS TO THE FLOOR
AND HE STOPS WORKING.
TUTS
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 6
(D) Can’t you bond that bit back?
Of course I can, that’s not the point.
F/X THE COMM RINGS AGAIN, A 1980S PULSE PHONE THIS TIME.
Sorry, I’ve got to take this. It’s Chica.
Of course.
F/X WALTON CUTS HER CALL.
Yes?
F/X PULSE STOPS AND CHICA ST JUDE (MID-20S, UNSTEADY BUT WITH
A HARD EDGE) APPEARS ON THE SCREEN.
(D) Anton? There’s some people in the commercial zone.
There usually are.
(D) No, new people. They turned up in a box, it just appeared. Four of them.
What are they doing?
(D) Not a lot, but with a ship that just appears in the middle of somewhere —
Yeah, sure, they could be our perps. I’1l put a shirt on and come down. Get three other guys and wait for me.
(D) Sure. I like your sculpture.
Thanks.
F/X SCREEN BLINKS OFF.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 5. INT. SHOP
F/X TEGAN LOOKING THROUGH MECHANISED RACKS OF CLOTHES, WITH
NYSSA.
(OFF) Do you need any help?
We're just browsing, thanks. (TO NYSSA) What do you think of this one?
Tegan, you know I don’t know anything about clothes.
You always wear nice stuff.
But Earth tastes are very.. different, aren’t they?
(BEAT) Is that a nice way of saying you hate the way I dress?
No, no.
Maybe you should look for some new clothes. Something a bit less... middle-aged?
I’m very comfortable in these.
You’re all right, I’m just —
F/X TEGAN IS GOING TO SAY ‘JUST KIDDING’ BUT STOPS DEAD WHEN A
WHINE STARTS UP.
Tegan? Tegan, are you all right? Say something.
F/X NYSSA CLAPS HER HANDS.
Tegan? Can you hear me? (TO SELF) No, you can’t. (BEAT) Where’s
that noise coming from...?
F/X NYSSA WALKS AROUND TO SHOP, NOISE GETS LOUDER.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 8
Excuse me? You, in the changing room? I can see your feet.
F/X DOOR OPENS. NOISE IS LOUDER AGAIN. VIOLET (MID-20S,
CHIRPY) IS INSIDE.
Ah. Hello.
What are you doing? (BEAT) Is that a smallwave neural scrambler?
Yes. And it doesn’t seem to be working.
I think it’s just me it doesn’t work on. Did you make it?
Oh no. I got it off an ex-serviceman. Poor guy’s an invalid, army won’t pay his bills. He’s still got some of his tech.
And you’re using it to steal things.
Only this spacesuit. And only because they won’t sell me one.
Why not?
Well, because I’m a backer.
Backer?
Piggybacker. You’re not Company, are you?
No, I’m new here.
Well those of us who can’t afford the shuttle fare, we hitch. You must be posh if you’ve never heard of backing.
I suppose I must be. So why won’t they let you buy a spacesuit?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 9
Only company can buy spacesuits. They’ve got to let us hitch, by law, but apart from that they’ve got us over a barrel — and they don’t like us going out, in case we steal anything.
And is that what you’re doing?
No, I’d never steal anything. Well, except this spacesuit. (BEAT) Can I trust you?
Yes.
It’s my friend, Manny. He went out. Got a suit on the black market. Then the comms went down. He’s been gone for ages, I’m afraid something’s happened.
And you can’t tell the staff here because he shouldn’t have been out in the first place.
Even if they knew they wouldn’t do anything, they’re busy with these thefts and they don’t care anyway. Please, I’m really worried — he’s been gone for hours.
(BEAT) You shouldn’t go out there on your own.
I know, but I can’t ask anyone here to —
You don’t have to. Where do they keep the spacesuits?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 6. EXT. COMMERCIAL ZONE
F/X DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH AMBLING ABOUT. A NEWS BROADCAST PLAYS
THEY TALK OVER IT.
(D) .. were not involved. The incident has been referred to SysPol, who are not treating it as suspicious.
Doctor, look.
Ah, yes. News broadcast. Interesting.

(D; OVERLAPPING) Speaking on behalf of the Global Commission this afternoon, Georges Yakubu dismissed the reports of military manoeuvres on Phobos and refrained from commenting further, stating that such speculation was unhelpful at this time. The Jupiter Axis has also refused to comment, although senior figures have privately stated that the present situation is unacceptable. The Europa Union is (STATIC) in its support of
STATIC) action if the (STATIC
Oh.
(D) We apologise for the loss of reception. We will endeavour to reinstate the mediafeed or locate another within range.
There — see, Turlough? The logo on the screen.
Panenka Haulage.
The comet we’re on must be eight slash Q Panenka.
You say that like it’s an old friend.
The chap who discovered it was. Eight slash Q Panenka, craggy little place, circumference of about thirteen point two kilometres, has an elliptical orbit which takes it between Earth and Jupiter.
Useful for haulage.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 11
If you catch it at the right time. If you catch it at the wrong time —
F/X A DOOR OPENS, REVEALING FIVE GUARDS WHO STEP FORWARD AND
THEIR WEAPONS.
Stop!
Oh dear. Security.
Don’t move.
We have stopped moving. Who are you?
Anton Falcao, Head of Responsibility. Are you armed?
Rarely, if ever.
Cocky, aren’t they, Chica?
Zane, Kim — check them for weapons.
F/X GUARDS START PATTING DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH DOWN.
Look, we’re not going to give you any trouble.
We’re just visiting.
Right. Just visiting in your ship that lands inside things without asking permission first.
Grab the blue box, fellas. Take it to the workshop.
All this just for walking around your plaza?
No, all this for stealing eleven-point-three Q’s worth of stock from our hold over the past few months.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 12
That wasn’t us.
Don’t deny it.
Tell us what we’re meant to have stolen.
Almost thirty per cent of the cargo.
What? But the capacity of this place must be — How could anyone hope to steal all that from under your noses?
With a ship that materialises inside things, maybe.
(BEAT) Ah.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 7. INT. SHOP
F/X NYSSA PICKING UP SPACE SUITS FROM RACK. VIOLET’S GADGET
WHINES IN BACKGROUND.
This looks like Tegan’s size.
Are you sure about this?
It doesn’t sound like anyone else is going to help. Shall we go?
We'll have to carry your friend out. If I turn off the scrambler, the girl on the counter will wake up and raise the — [alarm]
F/X SCRAMBLER STOPS.
It’s cut out! Piece of —
(OFF) Hey! Put those back!
(COMING ROUND) What’s happening? Nyssa?
We’re running.
Nothing changes.
Come on!
F/X THEY ALL PELT OUT OF THE SHOP.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 8. EXT. COMMERCIAL ZONE
F/X AS BEFORE.
Cuff them.
F/X DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH ARE PUT IN HI-TECH CUFFS.
There were two others with you. Where are they?
They’re —
Oh, them? Just a couple of girls we picked up.
Turlough —
I didn’t even catch their names, to be honest.
(CATCHING ON) That’s right. Hitch-hikers.
(BEAT) Take a look around for them, Chica. Check the backers’ camp.
(LOW) You know I don’t like going down there.
(LOW) We’re not debating it. I’ve had enough of you talking back. We are tightening up.
(LOW) All right, all right. (NORMAL) Craig, can we get headshots off the closed [circuit?]
F/X ALARM RINGS ACROSS THE PLAZA.
What now?
F/X ST JUDE CHECKS COMM.
Report of theft from Practicasual.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page
Get on that first. (POINTEDLY) Maybe they’re connected?
Don’t look at us.
Craig, Kim — let’s go.
F/X ST JUDE AND TWO GUARDS RUN OFF ACROSS PLAZA.
As for you two — that way.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 9. EXT. BACKERS’ CAMP
F/X NYSSA, TEGAN AND VIOLET DASH THROUGH A RAMSHACKLE
SETTLEMENT. SOUNDS OF MUSIC, COOKING, CHATTING, GAMES — BUT
THIS, ALARMS.
Through here. I just need to grab something from my tent.
NYSSA3: You live here?
Her and about a hundred others.
A hundred and eight. You wait out here.
F/X VIOLET DASHES INSIDE A TENT. WE STAY WITH NYSSA AND TEGAN.
Nyssa, what’s going on?
Her friend’s missing and she had to steal a spacesuit so she could go outside and look for him because people like her aren’t allowed spacesuits.
Oh. Fair enough.
F/X VIOLET RETURNS.
Got it. Come on, there’s an exit that way.
F/X THEY ALL RUN.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 10. INT. WALTON’S OFFICE
F/X WALTON IS TALKING TO HER COMPUTER.
Open new mailshot doc.
F/X BLEEP.

Begin. ‘Dear blank. As a loyal Panenka Haulage customer who has used our services in the past, we’d like to show our gratitude by offering you a free’ — put ‘free’ in capital letters. And bold. ‘.. free upgrade to our Executive service on our next haulage tour. This entitles you to —’
F/X A CALL IS COMING IN.
Yes?
F/X SCREEN BLINK.
(D) I think we’ve got them.
Got who?
(D) The guys who've been stealing all our stuff.
(BEAT) Are you sure?
(D) They have the means, they fit the bill.
Really?
(D) You don’t have to sound so surprised.
I just — No, you’re right. Credit where it’s due.
(D) I’m taking them in for questioning now.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 18
Good. Listen, the shareholders are really on my back. I shouldn’t say, but they’re having a meeting about whether to force me to replace you.
(D) Didn’t you tell them [I’ve been —]
Don’t worry, I fought your corner, but if we can get a result...
(D) Understood.
F/X FALCAO CUTS THE CALL.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 11. INT. SETTLEMENT (CORRIDOR)
F/X NYSSA, TEGAN AND VIOLET ARRIVE OUTSIDE AN AIRLOCK.
Is this the airlock?
Yes. Stand back, I need to crack the lock.
F/X VIOLET OPERATES HER SCRAMBLER.
Hang about, I thought that thing of yours only scrambled brains?
Depends on the setting. With the safety gate off...
F/X FRITZED ELECTRICS. SCRAMBLER OFF. AIRLOCK GRINDS OPEN.
There.
You’ve done this before.
I’ve been around.
F/X GUARDS ARE RUNNING DOWN THE CORRIDOR BEHIND THEM.
(LONG WAY OFF) Stop!
Guards!
Inside.
F/X THEY ALL BUNDLE INTO THE AIRLOCK. AIRLOCK STARTS TO CLOSE,
THE AMBIENCE BECOMES MORE ‘ROOMY’, THE STOMPING OF THE GUARDS’
BECOMES MORE MUFFLED AS IT CLOSES.
Come on, suit up.
F/X BEGINS SUITING UP.
Before the guards get in? How?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 20
Easy, if I just —
F/X USES HER GADGET AGAIN. SOMETHING FUSES IN THE AIRLOCK.
There.
You’ve blown out the lock?
Keep suiting up.
F/X ST JUDE AND HER GUARDS BASH FRUITLESSLY AT THE DOOR.
(MUFFLED) Let us in, you three! You’re in violation of — everything.
(LOW) Nyssa, are you sure about this?
(LOW) She seemed to need our help.
F/X THEY ALL PUT SPACE HELMETS ON AND SPEAK THROUGH RADIOS.
(D) Ready?
(D) Ready.
(D) Ready.
F/X VIOLET OPENS THE OUTER AIRLOCK DOOR.
(D) Let’s go.
F/X THE THREE OF THEM RUN OUT OF THE AIRLOCK.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 12. INT. SETTLEMENT (CORRIDOR)
F/X DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH BEING MARCHED ALONG.
Don’t you have security cameras in your hold? Surely you’d have seen the TARDIS on those before now.
There’s always interference on the images. They’ve - you’ve got some kind of disruptor.
Have we really?
Interference only lasts a minute or two. When the lights come back on, stuff’s gone.
We wouldn’t know how to do that.
That’s what anyone who did it would say. (ALL STOP) We’re here.
(LOOKING AT WALL) I must say, these paintings are really very good.
F/X FALCAO HITS A DOOR SWITCH. IT MAKES AN ‘ERROR’ NOISE.
Locked?
F/X TRIES DOOR AGAIN, SAME RESULT. FALCAO HITS HIS COMM.
Patricia?
(D) Yes?
I need something to use as an interrogation room. Hotdesk 1 is closed for redecoration.
(D) How about the break room?
The break room?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 22
(D) It’s got chairs and a lock on the door, hasn’t it?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 13. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X FADE UP. EMPLOYEES HAVING COFFEE AND CHATTING (SEE
APPENDIX). BLAND AMBIENT MUSIC. DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH MARCHED
BY FALCAO.
Clear out of here. I need to use this room. (BEAT) Please.
F/X EMPLOYEES TUT AND SLOPE AWAY. DOOR SHUTS BEHIND THEM.
Lovely view.
Are you being sarcastic?
Not at all. How big is this settlement?
Three hundred and sixteen employees. And thanks to you, they might not be employed much longer.
And this place looks to be.. less than a kilometre across, I'd say. Presumably the hold is bigger.
As if you haven’t seen the hold. I’m going to change this wretched music.
F/X FALCAO OPERATES CONTROLS ON A MEDIA UNIT.
If I recall correctly the orbit of this comet is relatively fast, makes a full circuit in three years and three months.
F/X MUSIC CHANGES TO AVANT-GARDE INSTRUMENTAL POP MUSIC WITH
AN IRREGULAR TIME SIGNATURE.
That’s better.

If the year is 2329, and you’re nearly back at Earth... (MUTTERS ) Twenty, thirty, forty, fifty... and if Jupiter was... Yes, you have conjunction, almost ideal in fact. Journey time about eighteen months. Am I right?
Yeah, well — I’m sure you done your research.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 24
I worked it out in my head just now, honestly.
Don’t worry, Doctor — I’m impressed.

But you won’t get conjunction next time around. Jupiter will be about fifty degrees from where you need it to be. May as well use a freighter and go direct. Not looking too good the next time either. Could be a lean six years —
Sit down.
Here, or —
(SHOUTS) Shut up! You’re doing yourself no favours with this smug, arrogant — [attitude]
F/X FALCAO’S COMM BLEEPS.
I’m going to get this and then afterwards it will get serious, believe me.
F/X FALCAO LEAVES THE ROOM, CLOSES DOOR BEHIND HIM.
We are going to get out of this, yes?
Oh of course. They can’t possibly have a case.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 14. INT. CORRIDOR
F/X FALCAO ANSWERS HIS COMM.
Falcao.
(D) It’s Chica. Those thieves. We lost them.
Lost them?
(D) They got to an airlock and then sabotaged it from the other Side. But it was the other two from the ship, plus one of the backers.
They’re professionals, they must be!
(D) I’1l take a patrol out and —
No, wait. Where can they go? Watch for any ships coming in or taking off. If someone comes to pick them up, we get them too. If not, we catch them when they try to get back in.
(D) Got it.
F/X COMM OUT.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 15. EXT. COMET
F/X NYSSA, TEGAN AND VIOLET RUNNING ACROSS THE SURFACE. ALL
WITH RADIO DISTORTION ON VOICES THROUGHOUT. TEGAN STUMBLES.
(D) Whoa!
(D) Careful!
F/X THEY ALL STOP AND REST.
(D) We’re not used to gravity this low.
(D) Take care. You can float away completely if your boots lose traction. Make sure the grips lock on every time you take a step.
(D) Thanks. Are the guards still following us?
(D) They don’t seem to be.
(D) Maybe they’re just going to wait for us to come back, when we run out of air.
(D) We should get on with looking for your friend then, shouldn’t we? What’s his name?
(D) Manny.
(D) Do you have any idea where he went?
(D) He’ll have gone this way initially, the cleanest water is over there. But that’s less than half an hour away and he’s been gone for nine hours, so —
(D) He could be anywhere. Spread out and keep in radio contact, I guess.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 16. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X FALCAO RE-ENTERS.
Your friends just stole some spacesuits and fled the settlement. Not the sort of thing innocent people do.
I told you, we don’t know them.
F/X FALCAO MOVES A CHAIR, SITS ON IT.
Save it. What kind of operation are you guys running?
We’re not.
You're not terrorists. There’s stuff you could’ve taken and used to make bombs, but you didn’t. So you’re stealing to sell Tt .on.
Look, if we really had it in us to carry out the kind of stealth raids you’re talking about, why would we suddenly blunder in and let ourselves get caught so easily?
Maybe you’ve just got complacent.
Do you have a single piece of evidence that we’ve actually been in your hold?
I don’t think you ever got out in the hold. I think you rigged something up so the stuff disappeared when your ship did. What is that ship, military hardware? You steal that too?
That’s a baseless assertion.
We’ll see. We can’t offer you a lawyer so you’1l have to represent yourselves.
Then I’1l need to see the evidence against us, whatever it is.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 28
Of course, you have a right to a fair trial and you can request anything you need to present your case. Your trial will take place at nineteen-hundred hours.
Today?
F/X FALCAO IS GETTING UP.
Today.
F/X FALCAO LEAVES THE ROOM, CLOSES DOOR.
(BEAT) This is starting to feel ominous.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 17. EXT. COMET
F/X WE’RE WITH MANNY. SHALLOW, LABOURED BREATHING; PAINED
SOBS.
(WEAK) Aaaah... help... suh-someone —
F/X SUDDENLY THERE’S A RADIO IN HIS EARS.
(D) Hello? This is a short-range, all-frequencies broadcast — Can anyone hear me?
Wuh...? Yes. Yes!
(D) That’s him!
(D) Where are you? Move if you can.
I’m not... I’m not sure IT...
(D) Nyssa, I see him — he’s just near me. Hey there. Mate! Is your name Manny?
Wuh... who...?
(D) Easy, Manny. Easy. We’re going to sort you out, OK?
Violet...?
(D) You’re with him now?
(D) Yeah. Come on, quick — I don’t know what to do!
COUGHS UP BLOOD
D) He’s in a bad way — coughing up blood. Quickly! (TO MANNY
Hang in there, Manny.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 18. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X DOOR OPENS, ST JUDE WALKS IN.
Did you get my request?
Yeah, we’ve released the security footage to your desktop. I don’t know what you expect to find. There’s just interference, then the picture clears and the stuff’s gone.
These spells of interference, can I see an example?
F/X ST JUDE OPERATES THE CONTROLS, STATIC HISS COMES FROM
TERMINAL.
There.
Aha.
It’s just a fuzzy screen.
There is some signal in there. It’s just a case of teasing it out by neutralising the interference, as far as one can.
You think we didn’t try that?
No, but I think you failed.
F/X DOCTOR OPERATES THE CONTROLS.
I bet it doesn’t work.
Yes, well our liberty is at stake, so I think we’ll have a bash. Just means running several sets of simultaneous equations, and then... right, here goes.
F/X DOCTOR KEYS IN A LONG STRING OF NUMBERS, ENDING WITH A
‘ENTER’ FLOURISH.
Let’s see...
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 31
F/X STATIC ABATES.
Woah.
It’s not perfect, I know, but enough to let us see what’s going on.
Er... Doctor? Have you seen what’s going on?
(BEAT) It can’t be.
F/X SOUND OF TARDIS LANDING ON THE FOOTAGE.
Oh dear.
But we’ve never been aboard this comet before. I’m telling you.
F/X TARDIS DEMATERIALISES ON FOOTAGE.
And the stolen materials disappear when you do. Thanks, guys.

FALCAO: You're not terrorists. There’s stuff you could’ve taken and used to make bombs, but you didn’t. So you’re stealing to sell Tt .on.
DOCTOR: Look, if we really had it in us to carry out the kind of stealth raids you’re talking about, why would we suddenly blunder in and let ourselves get caught so easily?
FALCAO: Maybe you’ve just got complacent.
TURLOUGH: Do you have a single piece of evidence that we’ve actually been in your hold?
FALCAO: I don’t think you ever got out in the hold. I think you rigged something up so the stuff disappeared when your ship did. What is that ship, military hardware? You steal that too?
DOCTOR: That’s a baseless assertion.
FALCAO: We’ll see. We can’t offer you a lawyer so you’1l have to represent yourselves.
DOCTOR: Then I’1l need to see the evidence against us, whatever it is.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 28
FALCAO: Of course, you have a right to a fair trial and you can request anything you need to present your case. Your trial will take place at nineteen-hundred hours.
DOCTOR: Today?
FALCAO: Today.
TURLOUGH: (BEAT) This is starting to feel ominous.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 29
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 17. EXT. COMET
DOCTOR WHO: SOBS.
MANNY: (WEAK) Aaaah... help... suh-someone —
NYSSA: (D) Hello? This is a short-range, all-frequencies broadcast — Can anyone hear me?
MANNY: Wuh...? Yes. Yes!
VIOLET: (D) That’s him!
NYSSA: (D) Where are you? Move if you can.
MANNY: I’m not... I’m not sure IT...
TEGAN: (D) Nyssa, I see him — he’s just near me. Hey there. Mate! Is your name Manny?
MANNY: Wuh... who...?
TEGAN: (D) Easy, Manny. Easy. We’re going to sort you out, OK?
MANNY: Violet...?
VIOLET: (D) You’re with him now?
TEGAN: (D) Yeah. Come on, quick — I don’t know what to do!
TEGAN: Hang in there, Manny.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 18. INT. BREAK ROOM
DOCTOR: Did you get my request?
ST JUDE: Yeah, we’ve released the security footage to your desktop. I don’t know what you expect to find. There’s just interference, then the picture clears and the stuff’s gone.
DOCTOR: These spells of interference, can I see an example?
DOCTOR: TERMINAL.
ST JUDE: There.
DOCTOR: Aha.
TURLOUGH: It’s just a fuzzy screen.
DOCTOR: There is some signal in there. It’s just a case of teasing it out by neutralising the interference, as far as one can.
ST JUDE: You think we didn’t try that?
DOCTOR: No, but I think you failed.
ST JUDE: I bet it doesn’t work.
DOCTOR: Yes, well our liberty is at stake, so I think we’ll have a bash. Just means running several sets of simultaneous equations, and then... right, here goes.
TRIUMPHANT: ‘ENTER’ FLOURISH.
DOCTOR: Let’s see...
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 31
ST JUDE: Woah.
DOCTOR: It’s not perfect, I know, but enough to let us see what’s going on.
TURLOUGH: Er... Doctor? Have you seen what’s going on?
DOCTOR: (BEAT) It can’t be.
ST JUDE: Oh dear.
DOCTOR: But we’ve never been aboard this comet before. I’m telling you.
ST JUDE: And the stolen materials disappear when you do. Thanks, guys.
TURLOUGH: What’s going on, Doctor?
DOCTOR: The footage must have been tampered with. Someone realised we would want to decode it, so they fabricated this ‘interference’ on purpose.
TURLOUGH: Even I think that sounds desperate. Are you sure you’ve never been here before? In your own future, even?
DOCTOR: I can’t see why I would.
TURLOUGH: I’m not saying you don’t have a good reason. Maybe one day you’1ll need all that stuff to save the galaxy, or something?
DOCTOR: Even if that was the case, the way the TARDIS lifted those materials — it doesn’t do that. We’re being framed.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 32
TURLOUGH: Why us?
DOCTOR: Wrong place, wrong time. We’re ideal suspects, and a few inconsistencies in the evidence won’t change that.
TURLOUGH: So who do you think’s responsible?
DOCTOR: Someone on the inside. Someone who needs to get a result.
TURLOUGH: Yes. (RAISING VOICE) Guards! I’d like to speak to Mr Falcao, please. Can you send him down?
DOCTOR: What are you going to say to Falcao?
TURLOUGH: Leave this to me.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 33
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 19. EXT. COMET
ALL: VOICES.
NYSSA: (D) He’s alive, then?
TEGAN: (D) Only just.
MANNY: (D) Th... the clouds...
TEGAN: (D) Don’t try to talk, Manny. Save your strength.
MANNY: (D) Shock... like lightning...
VIOLET: (D) How is he?
NYSSA: (D) Hard to tell under his suit.
TEGAN: (D) We need to get him back to the settlement. Have to face the
NYSSA: (D) We can’t carry him ourselves, it could be very dangerous to move him.
VIOLET: (D) I’1l call for help. Do you think he’1ll make it?
NYSSA: (D) If they come soon.
VIOLET: (D) This is Violet Silvaner, I have a major medical emergency, I’m attaching our location, send help now!
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 20. INT. WEAPON SITE (CONTROL ROOM)
VOICES: ARE A SORT OF HISSING WHOOSH.
VIOLET: (D) I have a major medical emergency, I’m attaching our location, send help now!
JOVIAN: 1: Will the settlement receive their message?
JOVIAN: 2:
JOVIAN: No. There is local interference. They will not save him. You should have made sure he was dead when you left his body out there.
JOVIAN: 1: The life-support systems of his suit must have —
JOVIAN: 2: We cannot afford another mistake like this. Not before we’re ready. If he tells them we are here —
MANNY: (D) Creatures — made of clouds!
NYSSA: (D) Manny, don’t try to sit [up —]
MANNY: (D) They’ve built something — on the other side. They did this — lightning bolts —
JOVIAN: 2: They know. They will find us. And when they do, we cannot let them leave.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 21. INT. BREAK ROOM
DOCTOR: Why would anyone steal these particular items?
TURLOUGH: To sell them on, presumably. Like Falcao said.
DOCTOR: Yes, but some of them are so low-cost, others are high-value. You’d think they’d want to maximise their [ill-gotten gains] —
FALCAO: You wanted to see me?
TURLOUGH: Ah yes. I’d like to confess, please.
DOCTOR: What?
FALCAO: Excellent.
TURLOUGH: On condition of immunity from prosecution. I’1l turn evidence against my accomplice if you let me go.
DOCTOR: Turlough?
FALCAO: I don’t know —
WALTON: (D) Yes, we accept.
FALCAO: How long have you been listening in, Patricia?
WALTON: (D) Quite a while. The central plaza is all set up for court proceedings, we can go straight to trial. Prepare to take his statement.
FALCAO: Right then. Come on.
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 36
TURLOUGH: Sorry, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Turlough, this isn’t the way.
TURLOUGH: It’s been fun, but... I think we’ve hit a dead end, don’t you?
DOCTOR WHO: THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 37

elements.text: PART TWO
NO REPRISE
SCENE 22. EXT. COMET
F/X: ALL IN SPACESUITS.
(D; WEAKLY) Creatures. Made of c-clouds — (GASPS. SHALLOW
UNTIL INDICATED)
(D) Manny? Manny?
(D) Oh rabbits. Nyssa! What’s happening to him? He said something about a lightning bolt?
(D) I heard, but his injuries could be consistent with components in his suit shorting out. (TO VIOLET) You said he got it on the black market?
(D) Yes, but could that really [cause —]
(D) Yes, it could! Right now, it’s only the suit’s life support systems keeping him alive. But I think they’re failing.
(D) Failing-?!
(D) Violet, is there still no response from the settlement?
(D) No, not yet.
(D) Well, why not? What’s the matter with them?
F/X IN B/G, MANNY STOPS BREATHING.
(D) Like I said, there’s been a lot of interference lately. We’ve even lost touch with Earth [a few —]
(D) He’s stopped breathing.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 38
(D) What?
(D) Nyssa, you’re the one who hangs around in hospitals. What do we do?
(D) His suit’s systems have shorted out. We need a defibrillator — one that will work though his spacesuit.
(D) Well, we haven’t got one!
(D) Thank you, Tegan, I realise that! (BEAT) Violet — your scrambler.
(D) My scrambler-?
(D) Yes, pass me your neural scrambler. Now!
F/X VIOLET HANDS NYSSA SCRAMBLER.
(D) I’m no expert, but isn’t that about as much use as a spacehopper to a wallaby?
(D) The suit will deflect the charge if I try to restart his heart with it. But with the safety gate off, it might be enough to boost the power to his suit’s life support systems.
(D) I get you-!
(D) Clear-!
F/X CLICKS SCRAMBLER: FIZZ. BEAT.
(D) Try again.
(D) Clear-!
F/X CLICKS SCRAMBLER: FIZZ. BEAT.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 39
(D) Nyssa...?
(D; FRUSTRATED) I thought... I really thought it was going to work.
(D) What...?
(D) I’m sorry.
Oh no. Manny! (CRIES)
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 40
SCENE 23. EXT. COMMERCIAL ZONE
F/X CHATTER FROM FAIR-SIZED CROWD — A HUNDRED PEOPLE OR SO
(SEE APPENDIX). THEN A DOOR OPENS AND THE DOCTOR IS ESCORTED
BY ST JUDE. THE CROWD REACTS NEGATIVELY TO HIS APPEARANCE, JEERING.
Is it necessary to hold my trial in the middle of the main plaza?
We don’t have a courtroom.
(OFF) Bring the accused forward.
Come on.
F/X ST JUDE NUDGES THE DOCTOR FORWARD. THEY WALK, ATTRACTING
GRUMBLES AND A FEW BOOS.
I wonder what the crowd have been told.
Dunno, none of my business.
That I’ve put their livelihoods, their futures at risk? That I’m the reason everything’s going to fall apart? Nothing to do with your little curve of profitability coming [to an end —]
Shut up, stand on the box and face the boss.
If I must.
F/X DOCTOR STEPS ONTO BOX — LIKE A WITNESS STAND.
Patricia Walton presiding. By the power vested in me by the constitution of Panenka, I bring Dr John Smith to stand trial.
By jury?
No, by me. You stand accused of trespassing on, and stealing cargo from, this facility. How do you respond?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 41
Not guilty.
F/X RIPPLE OF DISSENT FROM CROWD.
A guilty plea will result in a reduced sentence.
In that case, it’s a shame I didn’t do it.

The case for the prosecution will be presented first, and then you will have an opportunity to defend yourself. We’1ll begin with the testimony of your accomplice. (CALLING) Mr Falcao, produce your witness.
F/X TURLOUGH AND FALCAO ENTER. CHATTER IN CROWD.
Evening.
The witness will stand and face the accused. (BEAT) Your name, please.
Vislor Turlough.
Mr Turlough has admitted responsibility for a series of large- scale thefts from the hold.
Has he indeed.
Yes. You see, we wanted money. Lots and lots and lots of money.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 42
SCENE 24. EXT. COMET
F/X NYSSA LOOKING OVER MANNY’S BODY.
(D) Where did Violet say she was going?
(D) Just away, to gather her thoughts. I think she probably just didn’t want to spend any more time sitting with her dead boyfriend.
(D) What do you mean, boyfriend?
(D) Nyssa, it’s obvious. Can she hear us?
(D) No, helmet comms are set on one-to-one.
(D) So what do you think happened to him? His suit fritzed out, like you said? An accident?
(D) That’s what it looks like. Specifically, what we’re meant to think it looks like.
(D) Meant to think-? Wait — Violet’s coming back.
(D) Violet! Are you all right?
(D) I’ve just been looking around out there. No footprints in any direction. Except the ones we just made.
(D) You're saying they’ve been covered over?
(D) I’m not sure how you’d cover over tracks out there. Boot- grips always leave marks in the ice. It’s as if he didn’t walk here at all.
(D) Cloud-creatures, he said. I wonder...
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 43
SCENE 25. EXT. COMMERCIAL ZONE
F/X AS BEFORE. ODD BITS OF CHATTER FROM CROWD, JUST ENOUGH TO
US THEY’RE THERE.
. with the intention of selling it on the black market when we
reached Earth.
So where’s the stuff now?
Long gone, I expect.
No, you see the TARDIS isn’t capable of carrying that load over any great distance, so we hid it.
F/X HUBBUB IN CROWD: THIS IS UNEXPECTED.
Please, I have to protest —
You’1l have your opportunity to contest Mr Turlough’s later. (TO TURLOUGH) Where do you claim you hid it?
On the comet.
F/X MORE HUBBUB. GOOD NEWS!
(BEAT) I don’t believe you.
Where on the comet?
Several locations. Have you got a map?
(TO A COMPUTER) Map.
F/X BING! MAP APPEARS OVER THEIR TABLE.
But this doesn’t make sense.
Quite.
sort of
testimony
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 44
I thought I was questioning him.
How did you plan to pick it up?
When we got close to Earth, we’d have used the TARDIS to do a short hop and take it with us.
F/X WHEN TURLOUGH TOUCHES THE MAP (AND SAYS ‘HERE’), THERE ARE
BLEEPS.
Now, the stolen materials are hidden here, here, here... here... both of those... was there one here?
Why so many sites?
If one was discovered, we’d have had time to clear the others. Yes, definitely here — and here, and here, and here. And here.
But there can’t be one there.
Why not?
Because — Well it’s in the unstable zone.
Unstable zone?
Yes, the crust there fractured six years ago. Nobody goes there, it’s incredibly dangerous.
Well we must have just been lucky.
But this entirely lacks credibility.
But we can’t ignore this, we have to go and look. Patricia, we could recover everything we’ve lost. No need to default.
F/X CROWD IS BEHIND THIS.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 45
I’1ll take a look at this one in the unstable zone.
What? You will?
I can’t send a man in there if I’m not willing to go myself. Thank you, Mr Turlough.
You’re welcome.
(TO GUARD) O’Hara, take him back to the break room.
F/X FALCAO AND TURLOUGH BOTH LEAVE.
So, while we’re waiting, perhaps we could take a look at the other evidence? Oh wait, there isn’t any.
F/X CROWD DOESN’T LIKE THIS.
Perhaps the assembled employees would like to see the security footage which the defendant himself decoded?
F/X CROWD DOES LIKE THIS.
Oh of course, there’s that. Could the assembled employees bear in mind that the defendant would have to be an idiot —
(TALKING OVER HIM) No they cannot.
— to decode that footage if he knew his ship was likely to be on it, and consider the likelihood that the footage was forged so that he would find the opposite of what he expected to find?
F/X BOOS FROM CROWD.
You are in contempt of court.
Of course I am. It’s not even a proper court, it’s a shopping precinct. This is nothing more than a piece of stage-managed theatre.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 46
The charge will be added to those already put to you. Carter, take him to the break room and confine him there until the patrols report back. We can’t have him trying to influence the public.
F/X WALTON LEAVES.
(CALLS AFTER HER) If I’m not allowed to influence anyone, there’s scarcely any point in my being counsel for my own defence, is there? (TO GUARD) Yes, all right, you don’t have to shove.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 47
SCENE 26. INT. SHUTTLE HANGAR
F/X FALCAO MARCHES ONWARD, ST JUDE NEXT TO HIM.
What are comms like?
Long-range still whacked, been down for hours. Short-range is all right though.
If we use all the shuttles we can get around all eleven sites within the hour. I’m assigning three-man parties to each shuttle.
What if the sites are guarded?
We’ll go in armed. (STOPS) You’re in charge ‘til I get back, St Jude.
Whatever you think, Mr Falcao.
(RAISING VOICE, ADDRESSING GUARDS) OK, then, people — whatever you find, don’t bring it back. We don’t have time. Leave one man standing sentry, we’ll arrange collection later.
And don’t take any stupid risks. If you run into trouble, widecast it right away.
Let’s get this wrapped up before bedtime, OK?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page
SCENE 27. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X DOOR OPENS, DOCTOR ENTERS.
Turlough.
Hello, Doctor.
Will you be all right with him, Mr Turlough?
Oh, I think so. He doesn’t often get violent.
Not often, no.
It’s your funeral.
F/X GUARD LEAVES, DOOR CLOSES.
I’m not angry, Turlough.
Really?
Mostly, I’m just disappointed.
You thought highly enough of me to be disappointed? That nice.
F/X OUTSIDE, DISTANT SOUND OF SHUTTLES TAKING OFF.
‘s
That’1ll be the shuttles taking off. To look for the things you
said we’d stolen.
Yes.
I’m not sure I understand. What do you plan to do when they get
there and find nothing?
I don’t think it matters, we’ll have escaped by then.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 49
(PENNY DROPS) Ah.
Yes. They’re down to a skeleton staff now, I doubt there’s even anyone available to listen in to this conversation.
Still, I doubt they’1ll just let us walk out of here.
No, but for all their bravado I don’t think they know what they’re doing. I think that’s what all the bravado’s about, actually.
I agree. They had a nice, quiet little town here, off the beaten track, not much of a target... and now, suddenly, they’re scared. I wish they’d let us help.
You still want to help? After how we’ve been treated?
Of course. If we don’t, imagine what it’1ll do to this community.
I'd be happy to see the back of this community, but fair enough.
I’m sorry I doubted you.
That’s all right, I did my best to make you doubt me.
You could have let me in on it.
Let’s just get out of here, shall we? You do the honours.
(LOUD) Aaaaaargh!
(CALLS) Guard! Guard! There’s something wrong with the prisoner! Come quickly — I think he’s dying!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 50
SCENE 28. EXT. COMET
F/X AS BEFORE.
(D) I don’t think the shuttle’s coming.
(D) Typical. They’d just leave someone to die out here —
(D) Even if they’d come straight away, there’s nothing they could have done for him.
(D) So should we try to carry him back?
F/X SHUTTLE NOISE COMING IN.
(D) But we still don’t know what really happened to —
(D) Quiet. What’s that sound...?
(D) Look! It’s the shuttle!
(D; LOW) What...?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 29. INT. SHUTTLE
F/X SHUTTLE RACING THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE. FALCAO IS AT THE
HELM.
We’re three kilometres away. Start taking us down, Pilot.
OK.
F/X JUST AS SHUTTLE STARTS TO DESCEND, A CRACKLE RACES THROUGH
THE INTERIOR AND ALL AROUND THEM.
Argh!
What is that?
Some kind of static. Burned my hands!
F/X MORE CRACKLE.
Don’t touch the instruments. (TO COMM) Chica, we've been struck by an... electrical storm?
(D) What? How?
I don’t know how else to describe it, that’s —
F/X HE’S INTERRUPTED BY A BIGGER CRACKLE. SHUTTLE NOSEDIVES.
We’re going down! Helmets on and pressurise your suits!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 52
SCENE 30. EXT. COMET
F/X WE CAN’T HEAR THE SHUTTLE DUE TO VACUUM — JUST THE
TALKING, ON RADIOS.
(D) He’s a bit low!
(D) He’s in trouble.
(D) Get down!
F/X SHUTTLE PASSES OVER, VERY CLOSE — THE DOWNDRAFT OF ITS
VIBRATES AGAINST EVERYTHING DOWN BELOW.
(D) Stay down, he’s going to — [crash! ]
F/X SHUTTLE CRASHES, SENDING SHOCKWAVE ACROSS THE GROUND.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 53
SCENE 31. INT. FALCAO’S OFFICE
F/X ST JUDE AT THE DESK, ON THE COMM. BRIEF SOUNDS OF CRASH,
THEN STATIC.
Anton?
F/X ST JUDE ADJUSTS THE CONTROLS.
(BEAT) Oh no.
F/X DOOR OPENS, WALTON ENTERS.
Any progress? I’m not sure that boy’s testimony is entirely — Why’s the comm making that noise? Can’t you turn it off?
It’s Anton.
What’s he making that noise for?
It’s crashed. His shuttle.
Oh my — How?
He said there was an... electrical storm?
That’s impossible.
I know it’s impossible, but it’s what he said and he’s not an idiot. (BEAT) What am I doing? I should get someone out there.
Wait, can we afford to do that?
Afford? The shuttles are out there, if we just [divert —]
But they’re gathering essential evidence.
But you just said — about Turlough —
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 54
Yes, but we still have to follow up the lead before the trial can continue.
We've got guys out there dying.
Or dead. Have you checked their suit vitals?
No.
F/X ST JUDE BRINGS UP A DISPLAY.
Um. I, I don’t think —
There’s nothing.
No.
They’re gone.
But the suits might have a malfunction — there might be interference, [or —]
We'll pick them up later. For now, those shuttles have a job to do. You’re in charge now, Chica. I’1ll upgrade your status and contract.
Patricia —
It’s what Anton would have wanted. To get the job done. Isn’t it?
F/X WALTON LEAVES. A MOMENT’S SILENCE. THEN A BLEEP FROM ST
JUDE'S COMM.
Um. Yes?
(D) The prisoners. They’ve escaped.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 55
(SIGHS) Right. Mobilise, I’1ll be there in a minute.
(D) Mobilise who?
(BEAT) Oh, grief.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 56
SCENE 32. EXT. COMET
F/X NYSSA, TEGAN AND VIOLET RUNNING TOWARDS THE WRECKAGE.
(D) Nyssa, be careful! The whole shuttle might blow up any minute!
(D) There could be someone alive in here. Violet, help me with this airlock.
(D) Oh! Right.
F/X SCRAMBLER AS BEFORE. AIRLOCK OPENS.
(D) There’s still pressure. Come on, Tegan.
(D) Oh, great.
CONTINUES INTO:
SCENE 33. INT. SHUTTLE
F/X AIRLOCK DOOR CLOSES.
(D) We’re OK to remove helmets — the shuttle’s still got pressure.
F/X THEY DO SO.
What a mess.
Look! Over here, this one’s still alive.
F/X NYSSA AND VIOLET RUSH OVER TO FALCAO.
His suit’s functional — can either of you pick up his signal?
I’1ll try.
F/X NYSSA SCANS, PICKS UP:
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 57
AGONISED WAILING, CONTINUES UNDER DIALOGUE
(WINCING) Agh.
Don’t worry. We’re here to help you.
There’s another one over here... dead. Injuries like Manny’s.
Ugh. And another here.
They’re dead?
I’m afraid so. Don’t try to move.
What are you doing out here? Nobody’s authorised to — (BEAT) You're the girls who were with the guys that robbed us!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 58
SCENE 34. INT. SETTLEMENT (CORRIDOR)
F/X DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH HURRYING DOWN THE CORRIDOR. ALARM
SOUNDS.
Are you sure the TARDIS is through here?
No, but this is my best guess.
F/X THEY STOP RUNNING, DOCTOR TRIES A DOOR.
Locked, of course.
F/X DOCTOR STARTS WORKING ON THE LOCK.
Can’t you sense the TARDIS’ presence or something?
Sadly, no.
Hurry up, Doctor. We’re lucky they haven’t found us al-
F/X ST JUDE EMERGES INTO CORRIDOR.
(OFF) Don’t move, right?
We’re not.
F/X ST JUDE WALKS OVER TO THEM.
That was clever, getting us to clear all the security staff of here.
Not clever enough.
Better luck next time.
out
There’s not going to be a next time. I’m in charge now and I’m
going to keep a lid on you two.
Have they fired Falcao or just demoted him?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 59
Neither.
He did seem rather incompetent, to be fair.
He’s dead.
(BEAT) Oh. Sorry.
How?
We didn’t do it.
He was going out to search one of the sites you gave us, the one in the unstable zone, and his shuttle went down.
Oh no.
You led him into a trap.
No, no I didn’t! I made it up, there’s nothing out there! Not that I know of, anyway.
They’re saying it was an accident, but I don’t buy it.
You're probably right not to, but we didn’t do it.
Then maybe it was your friends? The two women?
They’d never do something like this.

DOCTOR: to me —

Here.

(D) Well, you’1ll last longer in there than you will out in the open.

Be my guest.

SCENE 72. INT. BREAK ROOM
(D) Some people they kill, then they let others get away.

(D) Why are they doing this?
F/X PA SYSTEM OPERATES IN BACKGROUND: WE HEAR ST JUDE’S VOICE.
(D; OFF) The settlement is under attack. Get inside a room and block any air vents. Go!
I don’t understand. This is not like them.

F/X ST JUDE TAKES THE COMM.
(D, OFF) Is he mad?
(D, ASIDE) No, this is how he usually operates.
I’1ll find one and ask it. Speak soon.
(D) What?

Now... Violet’s blackout generator.
How do you get into it? It looks totally sealed.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 124
Yes. I could get inside it, but I’d need time and equipment... (BEAT) Help me pull up these floor panels.
F/X DOCTOR PULLS PANELS UP FROM FLOOR.
We need high-insulation cable. These things which look like black hosepipe.
F/X DOCTOR WRENCHES A PIECE FREE. TEGAN HELPS.

No, out of the back of one of those chairs. But I need the cable to earth it.

Exactly.
But that’s nuts!
Thank you for the vote of confidence. Now, strip this end of the cable and wrap it around the blackout generator.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 125
SCENE 73. INT. WEAPON SITE (OFFICE)
F/X BATTLE UNFOLDING ON SCREEN. NASH IS A LITTLE OFF-MIC IN
SCENE.
Ms Walton has been safely delivered downstairs. I should go and escort her up.
I’1ll do that. I’m keen to speak with her. You guard the prisoner.
Yes, ma’am.
F/X VIOLET LEAVES.
I can’t believe this is necessary.
Look at the strategy. They’re forcing the stragglers higher and higher up the building, so they only have to hold one floor at a time. Of course I helped them plan this.
Of course you did.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 126
SCENE 74. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X DOCTOR TINKERING WITH CABLES.
Right. Turn that monitor on so we’1ll know if we’ve managed to deal with the blackout generator.
Right.
F/X TEGAN TURNS IT ON: STATIC ON SCREEN.
Time to let one of our Jovian friends in, I think.
F/X DOCTOR OPERATES AIR-CONDITIONING CONTROLS.
Will that thing hold together?
Yes, but I’m not sure how long for. Whilst the Jovian is recharging I’1ll get somewhere between forty seconds and a minute to talk to it.
Talk fast.
I intend to.
F/X WHOOSH AS JOVIAN FORMS IN FRONT OF THEM.
Ah, they’ve noticed we’re open. (TO JOVIAN) Hello.
F/X DOCTOR OPERATES AIR-CONDITIONING CONTROLS AGAIN.
Now. Let’s talk.
Open the vents. Let me out.
Not before —
F/X JOVIAN RELEASES LIGHTNING BOLT WHICH HITS SHIELD, CRACKLES
DOWN CABLE.
It worked. Your shield actually worked!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 127
Of course. (TO JOVIAN) Why are you attacking the settlement?
To protect ourselves.
From what?
We know what Earth wants to do. its energy crisis. Our world is
What? Is that true?
It wouldn’t work. I’ve heard it solar engineering is beyond all
The Jupiter Axis.
It has found the solution to to become the new sun.
suggested, but that kind of but — Who told you this?
Aha! I knew you’d never have built a weapon like that off your
own bat. I’1l bet the Axis have oversee things, yes?
their own man over there to
Major Nash is... technically in charge.
You’re just here to do his dirty work. Now... I recall there was some tension between Earth and the Jupiter colonies in this period, but I didn’t think it ever came to anything.
You are wrong. Negotiations have broken down. War is imminent.
Are you sure?
We are united against Earth’s plans. We will stop you.
F/X LIGHTNING BOLT, EARTHED AWAY. SPARKS COME FROM THE SHIELD.
I don’t think it’s going to take too many more hits like that!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 128
SCENE 75. INT. WEAPON SITE (ENTRANCE)
F/X VIOLET DESCENDS STEPS. AIRLOCK OPENS, WALTON STEPS OUT
WITH A JOVIAN.
I have brought Patricia Walton.
I hate travelling with you people. Never quite feel myself afterwards.
You’re here. Good.
Who are you?
One moment, please. (TO JOVIAN) Jovian — could you go and fetch something else for me?
From the settlement?
Yes. Here’s the description.
F/X BLEEP.
Yes. I shall go now.
F/X AIRLOCK OPENS AGAIN, JOVIAN STEPS INSIDE.
Don’t I know you?
You’ve probably seen me around.
F/X AIRLOCK CLOSES AGAIN.
Well, I hope you’ve got a plan, because I [can’t go back —]
Don’t worry, we have a plan.
Good. The gun really isn’t necessary, you [know. ]
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 129
First — we tidy up a few loose ends.
F/X VIOLET SHOOTS WALTON DEAD. BODY FALLS TO FLOOR.
Nothing personal. Just the plan.

SCENE 76. INT. BREAK ROOM
F/X AS BEFORE. STILL STATIC IN BACKGROUND.
Listen to me, Jovian. The Axis are trying to set you at odds with Earth. Right now, Earth doesn’t even know you exist — is this really how you want to present yourselves?
In a show of strength. They will not dare cross us.
But if they knew there were sentient creatures on Jupiter —
It would change nothing.

Doctor, that thing’s not going to [hold. —]

F/X STATIC SUDDENLY CLEARS. SCREEN SPRINGS INTO LIFE.
(D) — were not involved in the incident, which occurred in the early hours of the morning.
Done it!

(D) More now on today’s dominant story, the new deal between Earth and the Jupiter Axis. Eurasian President Zhang Cheung has just spoken to us about the treaty, which she hails as ‘historic’ and says it offers confidence of peace and prosperity in the years to come.
These are the negotiations which you say broke down?
This... is not part of the plan.
F/X COMM SOUNDS.

(D) Good work, Doctor — we’re sending a distress call to Earth.
No — wait. Give me a moment to think.
F/X LIGHTNING BOLT FROM JOVIAN, EARTHED AWAY.
I said let me think!
I must talk to my fellows.
The timing of this can’t be a coincidence. The Axis have clearly kept this weapon a secret for years, and within hours of a new peace agreement an incident occurs which will expose it to Earth.
It could threaten the whole deal if Earth found out the Jupiter lot had been building that kind of weapon.

Quite — the Axis haven’t owned up to it, so Earth could easily use it as a pretext to invalidate the deal or demand a renegotiation. So let’s say they let someone discover the weapon — they let you in, Tegan. You said you were lucky to get out of there alive.
So I was meant to come back and tell everyone... and then they sent the Jovians to attack the settlement.
Earth will find out that one of their protectorates has been attacked by a previously unknown alien race. The Axis will deny any involvement with you or the weapon.
What you say —
— makes perfect sense. They’re setting you up as the fall guys for that whacking great gun they’ve built. They didn’t set up
the communications blackout to stop us getting a message out,
it was to stop you finding out about the peace deal.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 132
You've outlived your usefulness, now the Axis will set Earth on you. Earth and the Axis will unite against a common enemy, cementing their new alliance.

Convincing, though, isn’t it? And if I’m right, the consequences for you are catastrophic.
(BEAT) We have gone too far now. We have [killed —]
No. Stop now and we’1ll fight to convince Earth you were misled. It’s never too late to stop killing.
(BEAT) Open the door.
Thank you.
F/X DOCTOR OPENS THE DOOR. WHOOSH.
I hope you know what you’re doing.
The Jovians have been fed misinformation, a concerted campaign to terrify them. They’ve responded by becoming more brutal. Hopefully the truth will make them more reasonable again.
Do you really think you can convince Earth not to attack them?
I don’t know.
(D) Doctor? Can I send the distress call now?
No. Tell them nothing. If Earth calls, don’t pick up the phone.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 133

F/X IMAGES FROM SETTLEMENT STILL COMING THROUGH.
Don’t you think it’s gone very quiet over at the settlement, Major?
Yes.

First? (PAUSE) Come in, First.
Perhaps he’s dead.
Nonsense. That place is the worst-defended target I’ve ever tackled. What have they got?
The Doctor.
(D) Nash.
There you are, First.
(D) Why has a peace accord been announced?

(D) You pretend not to know?

(D) The Axis and Earth. The Doctor broke through your communications blackout.
I told you.
I think I would be the first to know if there was a deal.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 134

(SIGHS) So close.
What? It’s true?
Yes, there’s a deal.
With Earth?
Yes. And obviously we don’t want them to know we were building this, [so —]

Sorry. That’s showbiz. (TO NYSSA) Does your Doctor know what he’s doing? This could start a war...
You brought it on yourselves.
When were you going to tell me about this deal?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 135
The mission was all the more effective for you not knowing about the peace accord. But now I’1l have to go with plan B. Sorry, Major.
Why are you sorry?
Because plan B is the old rogue-officer routine.
(BEAT) Me?

You put this operation together in concert with Walton and the Jovians. The Jovians didn’t know you’d gone AWOL years ago. You had a grudge against Earth... we’ll work out the full story on the way home.
Home ?

Yes, we’ll hold the trial when we get back. Don’t worry, it’1l be the cushiest prison you could imagine. We should destabilise the unstable zone too, let this place fall to pieces. Remove Nyssa’s handcuffs, would you? We’1ll need her [for —]
No!
F/X NASH DRAWS A GUN —
Oh, and if you’re thinking of shooting me, I disabled your gun hours ago. Sorry.
(BEAT) It seems I have little option —
This way is best for everyone, Major — (GRABBED BY THROAT) Aah!
. but to see to you with my bare hands!
CHOKES

(STRUGGLING AGAINST HER HANDCUFFS) No! Please, Major, you mustn’t —
F/X VIOLET DIES, NASH LETS HER BODY FALL TO THE FLOOR. HE

AS WEAPON STARTS TO POWER UP.
Oh no. The cannon!

F/X KNOCK AT DOOR.

(OFF) It’s us.
F/X TURLOUGH AND ST JUDE OPEN THE DOOR. DOCTOR AND TEGAN
ENTER.
Doctor. The Jovians seem to be holding off.
I think I’ve convinced them. But we need evidence that the Jupiter Axis tricked the Jovians. If I’m going to save them, I need to —
F/X COMMS RING.
Hello?
(D) Who’s there?
Nyssa!
It’s good to hear your voice, Nyssa. Are you at the weapon site?
(D) Yes, and I’m handcuffed to the commanding officer’s desk. I’ve just about managed to reach his communications console.

(D) In the central control room. He’s locked the whole base down. And he’s preparing to fire the particle cannon at Earth. The countdown says twenty-six minutes.

Ah. That’s.. unfortunate.
We’ve got to warn Earth.
Why? There’s no way to defend against a weapon like this, and it’s too late for a preventative strike.
We’ve got to do something, Doctor.
Agreed, but even if we avert the strike, there’ll still bea war.
You said the tension in this time period never comes to anything.
(D) Maybe that’s because we’re supposed to intervene and make sure it doesn’t. So if we fail...
No pressure, then.
And right now, I can only imagine the peace deal holding if Earth never finds out that the Axis was trying to fire a particle cannon at one of its major cities.
You want to keep this a secret? How?
Simple. We use the TARDIS. Nyssa — stay on the line.
F/X DOCTOR HURRIES OUT OF THE ROOM.
(CALLING AFTER) Where are you going? Doctor? Doctor!
(FOLLOWING DOCTOR) Come on, Turlough!
F/X THE OTHERS FOLLOW. CROSSFADE TO:

No, no, no.. we don’t have time to look for it now.
You wanted to use it to get inside the weapon’s control room?
Yes. (BEAT) Of course. (CALLS) Jovians!

F/X JOVIAN DEPARTS.
Do you trust them?

How?

What?

Doctor, this place is our livelihoods.
How many?
Enough, all right? We’ve got canisters of cyanogen, if they go up they’1ll detonate the heavy batteries, and then... But it’s not just our jobs, it’s our home.
I do realise that.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 141
(BEAT) How do we do it?
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 142
SCENE 80. INT. SETTLEMENT (HOLD)
F/X FADE UP. DOORS OPEN, DOCTOR, TEGAN, TURLOUGH AND ST JUDE
IN. DOCTOR ACCESSING A STOCK-CHECKING COMPUTER.
Now, the materials we need are here, here and here. (TUTS) Could do with them being less spread out.
Funnily enough, we planned the storage layout to avoid a major explosion, rather than to cause one.
You were hoping to start a chain reaction?

Yes. We don’t have an explosive device capable of triggering this. I can build one, but I don’t have time to make sixteen, which is more like the number we need. One or two explosions won’t cut it — we need something bigger.
Don’t you have an auto-destruct system?
Why would we have an auto-destruct system?
How about moving the consignments closer together?
It’ll take too long. This place isn’t designed for shifting stuff around — we load everything on at the start of the trip, we load everything off at the end.
We need a simultaneous timed explosion in multiple locations but we have no explosives and not enough time to... (TAILS OFF)
What?
F/X WHOOSH AS JOVIAN ARRIVES.
Doctor. The TARDIS is not inside the settlement.
Right. Thank you for trying. (BEAT) There is another way, but I can’t —
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 143
We know what you want to ask.
You want them to trigger the explosion, don’t you.
Five minutes ago Earth were their sworn enemies.
We do not know what to believe. But we have no allies now. This strike will be a disaster for us.
You see? It’s as much in their interest as ours. (TO JOVIAN) But it will kill you. There’1l be no time to escape.
We are not proud of our actions here. We let fear and paranoia overtake us.

(BEAT) We can’t predict the effect the explosion will have on the comet’s course. It’s possible that the cannon will still be in position to make a shot, so what we have to do is make sure they don’t have time to correct.
So we have to leave it to the last minute.
I will gather the others.
F/X WHOOSH.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 144
SCENE 81. INT. WEAPON SITE (OFFICE)
F/X WEAPON STILL AUDIBLE IN THE BACKGROUND, POWERING UP.
(D) Nyssa?
Yes, Doctor?
(D) The Jovians are going to trigger the explosion we need. How long do we have?
Twenty-one minutes.
(D) Good. Keep the Jovians posted. We need to get everyone onto shuttles and away.
3: Of course.
(D) Nyssa... we can’t get you out of there just yet. I’m sorry.
NYSSA3: I know.
(D) The TARDIS has gone missing. I’m sorry — I have to concentrate [on —]
I know, Doctor. You don’t have to keep saying you’re sorry.
(D; BEAT) We’ll come for you. When all this is over, we'll follow the comet and get you back.
F/X COMM OUT.
(BEAT) You once said much the same about somebody else.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 145
SCENE 82. INT. SETTLEMENT (SHUTTLE BAY)
F/X ST JUDE’S VOICE ECHOES OUT ACROSS THE HANGAR AS SHUTTLES
PREPARE TO TAKE OFF.
(CALLS) OK, let’s keep it moving. Just get on and grab a seat aboard the shuttle. If there isn’t a seat, you’1ll have to stand.
Where’s the Doctor?
Still briefing the Jovians.
How long does it take?
F/X DOCTOR WALKS OVER TO THEM.
As long as it takes to say thank you for dying so millions can
live.
Let’s just get aboard the shuttle, shall we?
F/X THEY TRAIPSE INSIDE. ST JUDE USES THE PA AGAIN.
(D) Doors close in one minute, everybody!
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 146
SCENE 83. INT. WEAPON SITE (OFFICE)
F/X ROAR IN BACKGROUND AS WEAPON CONTINUES TO POWER UP. NYSSA
COMM.
Jovians?
(D) We are listening.
Has the shuttle left yet?
(D) In a few seconds.
Good. (BEAT) You’re doing a good thing. I suppose we both are.
(D) Thank you. Stay in contact.
I will.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 147
SCENE 84. INT. SHUTTLE
F/X DOORS CLOSE.
All right, everyone’s in. (CALLING) Pilot — you’re clear to go!
F/X SHUTTLE STARTS LAUNCH PREP: ENGINES START POWERING UP.
How fast are these things?
Not very. They’re mostly designed for short-range work. In an emergency they’1ll get us home, but —
— but they’re not the sort of thing you’d generally use to chase down a comet that’s been sent hurtling away into space by a massive explosion.
No.
F/X THE SHUTTLE LAUNCHES.
And have you told the Doctor this?
Yes.
We lost the TARDIS too.
A ship? Not the same as someone’s life, is it?
Not far off though. Not in this case.
Where is he? The Doctor?
On the flight deck, with Tegan.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 148
SCENE 85. INT. WEAPONS SITE (CONTROL ROOM)
F/X NASH OPERATING THE CANNON.
(TO SELF) Calibrate... and start focusing the charge.
F/X COMMS BLEEP.
(D) Major Nash?
Oh, be Ss yous,
(D) Please, you have to stop this.
It’s too late. The firing sequence is locked in.
(D) No it isn’t.
(BEAT) Well... I’m not changing my mind.
(D) We can stop you but it’1ll cost more lives.
Will it really. Good try, yes. Good try.
F/X NASH OPERATES CONTROLS.

(D) I’m sorry.
I’m not. Not a bit of it.
THE JUPITER CONJUNCTION by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 149
